alert.note: Alert for North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 5:27PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern St. Louis and northwestern Lake Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 525 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, to 10 miles northwest of Burntside Lake, to 8 miles northeast of Tower, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported this storm had produced pea sized hail near Orr. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Northwestern Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness around 530 PM CDT. Burntside Lake around 545 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Ely, Winton, Fall Lake, White Iron Lake and Basswood Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.

area.areaDesc: North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake
